thread.title: Dust Devils pummel Parker 65-6: Economou, Anderson shine; River Valley will be preparing for Havasu showdown
thread.title_full: Dust Devils pummel Parker 65-6: Economou, Anderson shine; River Valley will be preparing for Havasu showdown

author: RODD CAYTON The Daily News
title: Dust Devils pummel Parker 65-6: Economou, Anderson shine; River Valley will be preparing for Havasu showdown
text:
RODD CAYTON/The Daily News HAPPY DEVILS 
Dust Devils’ Devin Anderson (26) and Ryan Economou (14) get together after River Valley’s home romp over the Broncs on Friday night. Posted: Sunday, October 25, 2015 12:08 am | Updated: 1:30 am, Sun Oct 25, 2015. Dust Devils pummel Parker 65-6: Economou, Anderson shine; River Valley will be preparing for Havasu showdown By RODD CAYTON The Daily News MohaveDailyNews.com | 0 comments 
MOHAVE VALLEY — Ryan Economou and Devin Anderson put on an offensive fireworks show Friday night, and the River Valley High football team stormed past visiting Parker High School 65-6. 
Jacob Lee blocked two punts to set up scores for the 8-1 overall Dust Devils, who play at Lake Havasu High School on Friday for the Arizona Interscholastic Association Division IV, Section III title. 
Economou threw five touchdown passes and opened the scoring with a 1-yard TD run just over two minutes into the game. 
Anderson scored three TDs, including an 8-yard catch and a 41-yard run in the third quarter. 
RVHS co-head coach and offensive coordinator Paul Duchaineau said he wanted to work on the passing game before then showdown with Havasu. 
He said that Economou made a lot of smart decisions on which throws to make, and that the team’s receiving corps ran good routes. 
Economou said that when he saw the pass-heavy, game plan, he thought, “I’m about to get a lot of touchdowns.” 
The Dust Devils got off to a quick start, shutting the Broncs’ offense down after three plays and taking over within a step of the goal line after Lee blocked Marcus Drennan’s punt. 
Economou scored on the next play. 
The Dust Devils’ next possession ended with Pablo Sandoval intercepting Economou’s pass at the Broncs’ 1-yard line. 
On the next play, Lee sacked Broncs quarterback Josh Golding for a safety. RVHS led 9-0 at 7:12. 
Economou then ended a 45-yard drive with a 30-yard TD pass to Anderson 58 seconds later. 
Lee blocked a punt on the ensuing possession, leading to Economou’s 10-yard TD pass to Tristen Dozier. RVHS was up 23-0 less than eight minutes into the game. 
Duchaineau said Lee has blocked at least one kick in each of the past four games. He declined to talk about the senior linebacker’s/fullback’s technique. 
“We’re opening holes for him,” he said. 
Late in the quarter, Economou hit David Larrabee on a 24-yard TD pass. 
A 24-yard screen pass to Anderson set up Walter Klock’s 1-yard run to make it 37-0 about two minutes into the second quarter. 
Parker got on the board after starting with a short field due to a kickoff that went out of bounds and two personal-foul penalties. 
Jacob Gottula scored on a 1-yard run to make it 37-6 with 6:38 left in the half. 
The Dust Devils quickly answered with Economou’s 49-yard pass to Jesse Bravin, who bobbled the ball briefly before securing the catch and sprinting the last 25 yards or so. 
Halfway through the quarter, River Valley led 44-6. 
The clock ran continuously for most of the second half. Lee closed out the scoring with a 17-yard carry that Duchaineau called a reward for his hard work on defense and special teams. 
Broncs coach Jeston Lotts said that the plays RVHS ran were no surprise, but that the Dust Devils’ execution made an upset unlikely. 
Anderson had high praise for the defense, which he said was aggressive and flew to the ball as co-head coach and defensive coordinator Mark Ruckle teaches. 
Duchaineau said the Dust Devils will ramp up the intensity of this week’s practices in preparation for the contest against the 9-0 overall Knights. 
LHHS, like River Valley, is 6-0 in section. 
The Knights are ranked No. 4, according to the aiaonline.org ’s power-point system. 
The Dust Devils are ranked No. 9. 
Economou said he achieved one goal this week, namely sending his senior teammates out as winners in their last regular-season home game. 
Next up: defeating the Knights. 
“I’m excited about it,” he said. “I’ve heard they’ve been talking some smack. We need to go down there and beat them.”
